intro: Drosanthemopsis salaria, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with a shallow root system and the ability to store water in its leaves. Drosanthemopsis salaria is often found in rocky soils and is a popular choice for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
